title: Moulin Script
content:
Anyone know which font this Moulin script is written in?

Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823133423im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tumblr_loxjhkWHq61qhl7eto1_500_3549.jpg)
author: deez

comments.content: I think that's a custom job by Jean François Porchez.

(Part of the) Story [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823133423/http:/www.porchez.com/article/645).  
And for those who, like me, don't have Nick Cooke or Jean-François Porchez' talent, some I like (not saying they could be considered as equivalent): [Olicana](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823133423/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/g-type/olicana) (by aforementioned Nick Cooke), [Ability](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823133423/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scholtz/ability) (as many other [Anton Scholtz' fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823133423/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/Scholtz_Fonts) such as Silken...), [Alana](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823133423/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/laura-worthington/alana), [Freedom Writer](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823133423/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bomparte/freedom-writer-bf), [Chai Tea](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823133423/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-chai-tea) by Stephen Rapp (under P22 licence), [Corinthia](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823133423/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typesetit/corinthia) (more by [TySETiT Rob Leuschke](http://web.archive.org/web/20140823133423/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/TypeSETit))
wow! thanks for all the info. I really appreciate it :)
